24c9de98-7ac1-45c5-bc85-7aa63a19cd4d.description: An ABC Certified Prosthetist Orthotist is a health care professional specifically educated and trained to manage comprehensive prosthetic and orthotic patient care. Including patient assessment, formulation of a treatment plan, implementation of the treatment plan, follow-up and practice management. Prosthetic care may include patient evaluation, prosthesis design, fabrication, fitting and modification. Orthotic care may include orthosis design, fabrication, fitting and modification.
24c9de98-7ac1-45c5-bc85-7aa63a19cd4d.name: ABC Certified Prosthetist Orthotist (CPO)

issuer.summary: issued by American Board for Certification in Orthotics, Prosthetics & Pedorthics

entity.name: American Board for Certification in Orthotics, Prosthetics & Pedorthics

badge_template_activities.title: Master's degree in orthotics and prosthetics from a Commission on Accreditation of Allied Health Education Programs (CAAHEP) accredited program.
Completion of a National Commission on Orthotic and Prosthetic Education (NCOPE) accredited residency.
Passing score on the written, simulation and clinical patient management exams.

74d6ad95-4bde-471f-b12c-b0650e3f4dc9.description: An ABC Certified Pedorthist is a health care professional who is specifically educated and trained to manage comprehensive pedorthic patient care. This includes patient assessment, formulation of a treatment plan, implementation of the treatment plan, follow-up and practice management. ABC Certified Pedorthist’s fit, fabricate, adjust or modify pedorthic devices for the prevention or amelioration of painful and/or disabling conditions of the foot and ankle.
74d6ad95-4bde-471f-b12c-b0650e3f4dc9.name: ABC Certified Pedorthist (C.Ped.)

issuer.summary: issued by American Board for Certification in Orthotics, Prosthetics & Pedorthics

entity.name: American Board for Certification in Orthotics, Prosthetics & Pedorthics

badge_template_activities.title: High school diploma, GED or college degree.
Completion of 1,000 hours of pedorthic patient care experience.
Passing score on the written exam.

d66ee76e-ed4b-456f-bf4f-3ee9a2e146b9.description: An ABC Certified Fitter-orthotics is a health care professional specifically educated and trained in the provision of certain orthoses. This includes patient assessment, formulation of a treatment plan, implementation of the treatment plan, follow-up and practice management. An ABC Certified Fitter-orthotics is competent to practice orthotics within a scope of practice specific to fitting certain custom fitted, prefabricated and off-the-shelf orthoses.
d66ee76e-ed4b-456f-bf4f-3ee9a2e146b9.name: ABC Certified Fitter-orthotics (CFo)

issuer.summary: issued by American Board for Certification in Orthotics, Prosthetics & Pedorthics

entity.name: American Board for Certification in Orthotics, Prosthetics & Pedorthics

badge_template_activities.title: High school diploma, GED or college degree  and complete an American Board for Certification in Orthotics, Prosthetics & Pedorthics, Inc. (ABC) approved orthotic fitter pre-certification education course.

Completion of 1,000 hours of orthotic fitting patient care experience OR 500 hours of orthotic fitting patient care experience along with a current national recognized certification in a related allied health profession.
Passing score on the written exam.

c1b90d43-0e1f-4e47-87f7-1893d53a027b.description: An ABC Certified Orthotist is a health care professional specifically educated and trained to manage comprehensive orthotic patient care. This includes patient assessment, formulation of a treatment plan, implementation of the treatment plan, follow-up and practice management. Orthotic care may include, but is not limited to, patient evaluation, orthosis design, fabrication, fitting and modification to treat a neuromusculoskeletal disorder or acquired condition.
c1b90d43-0e1f-4e47-87f7-1893d53a027b.name: ABC Certified Orthotist (CO)

issuer.summary: issued by American Board for Certification in Orthotics, Prosthetics & Pedorthics

entity.name: American Board for Certification in Orthotics, Prosthetics & Pedorthics

badge_template_activities.title: Master's degree in orthotics and prosthetics from a Commission on Accreditation of Allied Health Education Programs (CAAHEP) accredited program.
Completion of a National Commission on Orthotic and Prosthetic Education (NCOPE) accredited residency.
Passing score on the written, simulation and clinical patient management exams.

6721a861-b72b-442d-b641-fc50790bca5e.description: An ABC Certified Prosthetist is a health care professional specifically educated and trained to manage comprehensive prosthetic patient care. This includes patient assessment, formulation of a treatment plan, implementation of the treatment plan, follow-up and practice management. Prosthetic care may include, but is not limited to, patient evaluation, prosthesis design, fabrication, fitting and modification to treat limb loss for purposes of restoring physiological function and/or cosmesis.
6721a861-b72b-442d-b641-fc50790bca5e.name: ABC Certified Prosthetist (CP)

issuer.summary: issued by American Board for Certification in Orthotics, Prosthetics & Pedorthics

entity.name: American Board for Certification in Orthotics, Prosthetics & Pedorthics

badge_template_activities.title: Master's degree in orthotics and prosthetics from a Commission on Accreditation of Allied Health Education Programs (CAAHEP) accredited program.
Completion of a National Commission on Orthotic and Prosthetic Education (NCOPE) accredited residency.
Passing score on the written, simulation and clinical patient management exams.

8dd34a64-6759-476e-a5c2-bedfb3f714fe.description: An ABC Certified Fitter-mastectomy is a health care professional who is specifically educated and trained in the provision of breast prostheses and post-mastectomy items and services. This includes patient assessment, formulation of a treatment plan, implementation of the treatment plan, follow-up and practice management.
8dd34a64-6759-476e-a5c2-bedfb3f714fe.name: ABC Certified Fitter-mastectomy (CFm)

issuer.summary: issued by American Board for Certification in Orthotics, Prosthetics & Pedorthics

entity.name: American Board for Certification in Orthotics, Prosthetics & Pedorthics

badge_template_activities.title: High school diploma, GED or college degree  and complete an American Board for Certification in Orthotics, Prosthetics & Pedorthics, Inc. (ABC) approved mastectomy fitter pre-certification education course.

Completion of 250 hours of mastectomy fitting patient care experience  OR 125 hours of mastectomy fitting patient care experience along with a current nationally recognized certification in a related allied health profession.
Passing score on the written exam.

c361c324-7852-47a9-afa7-91b8b24a376b.description: An ABC Certified Fitter-therapeutic shoes is a health care professional who is specifically educated and trained to provide non-custom therapeutic shoes and non-custom multi-density inserts. This includes patient assessment, formulation of a treatment plan, implementation of the treatment plan, follow-up and practice management.
c361c324-7852-47a9-afa7-91b8b24a376b.name: ABC Certified Fitter-therapeutic shoes (CFts)

issuer.summary: issued by American Board for Certification in Orthotics, Prosthetics & Pedorthics

entity.name: American Board for Certification in Orthotics, Prosthetics & Pedorthics

badge_template_activities.title: High school diploma, GED or college degree  and complete an American Board for Certification in Orthotics, Prosthetics & Pedorthics, Inc. (ABC) approved therapeutic shoe fitter pre-certification education course.
Completion of 250 hours of therapeutic shoe fitting patient care experience.
Passing score on the written exam.

cf110a1d-f999-44db-b2a4-aca629ffb915.description: An ABC Certified Orthotic Assistant is an individual educated and trained to participate in comprehensive orthotic care while under the supervision of an ABC Certified Orthotist. Under supervision, a Certified Orthotic Assistant may perform orthotic procedures and related tasks in the management of patient care.
cf110a1d-f999-44db-b2a4-aca629ffb915.name: ABC Certified Orthotic Assistant (COA)

issuer.summary: issued by American Board for Certification in Orthotics, Prosthetics & Pedorthics

entity.name: American Board for Certification in Orthotics, Prosthetics & Pedorthics

badge_template_activities.title: High school diploma, GED or college degree. Successful completion of three semester hours each of the following courses; Human Anatomy, General/Fundamental Physics and Medical Terminology. Each course must be from a regionally accredited institution of higher learning.
Completion of one year (1,900 hours) of clinical experience in orthotics under the supervision of an ABC Certified Orthotist.
Passing score on the written exam.

54223f24-f8d8-4b5c-9fff-6ef2c8f0325b.description: An ABC Certified Prosthetic Orthotic Assistant participates in comprehensive orthotic/prosthetic care while under the supervision of an ABC Certified Orthotist/Prosthetist. Under supervision they may perform orthotic/prosthetic procedures and related tasks in the management of patient care. They may also fabricate, repair and maintain orthoses and/or prostheses. ABC Certified Prosthetic-Orthotic Assistants may not use their credentials as independent providers of patient care.
54223f24-f8d8-4b5c-9fff-6ef2c8f0325b.name: ABC Certified Prosthetic Orthotic Assistant (CPOA)

issuer.summary: issued by American Board for Certification in Orthotics, Prosthetics & Pedorthics

entity.name: American Board for Certification in Orthotics, Prosthetics & Pedorthics

badge_template_activities.title: High school diploma, GED or college degree. Successful completion of three semester hours each of the following courses; Human Anatomy, General/Fundamental Physics and Medical Terminology. Each course must be from a regionally accredited institution of higher learning.
Completion of 18 months of clinical experience in both orthotics and prosthetics with a minimum of six months in each discipline.
Passing score on the written exams.

87d39a25-5573-4e41-b02b-7098cfd34bc3.description: An ABC Certified Prosthetic Technician is trained and qualified to assist an ABC credentialed individual by providing technical support. They may not use their credentials as independent providers of patient care. The Certified Prosthetic Technician fabricates, repairs and maintains prostheses and is proficient with current fabricating techniques, familiar with material properties and skilled in the use of appropriate equipment.
87d39a25-5573-4e41-b02b-7098cfd34bc3.name: ABC Certified Prosthetic Technician (CTP)

issuer.summary: issued by American Board for Certification in Orthotics, Prosthetics & Pedorthics

entity.name: American Board for Certification in Orthotics, Prosthetics & Pedorthics

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of a Commission on Accreditation of Allied Health Education Programs (CAAHEP)/National Commission on Orthotic and Prosthetic Education (NCOPE) approved technician education program OR hold a high school diploma, GED or a college degree.

Those who have not completed a CAAHEP/NCOPE technician education program are required to complete two years of technical experience in the discipline under the supervision of an ABC Certified Practitioner or ABC Certified Technician in the specific discipline.
Passing score on the written exam.

c675a4bf-b43b-4e39-9a4e-341d685e74f5.description: An ABC Certified Prosthetic Orthotic Technician is trained and qualified to assist an ABC credentialed individual by providing technical support. They may not use their credentials as independent providers of patient care. The Certified Prosthetic Orthotic Technician fabricates, repairs and maintains orthoses and/or prostheses, is proficient with current fabricating techniques, familiar with material properties and skilled in the use of appropriate equipment.
c675a4bf-b43b-4e39-9a4e-341d685e74f5.name: ABC Certified Prosthetic Orthotic Technician (CTPO)

issuer.summary: issued by American Board for Certification in Orthotics, Prosthetics & Pedorthics

entity.name: American Board for Certification in Orthotics, Prosthetics & Pedorthics

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of a Commission on Accreditation of Allied Health Education Programs (CAAHEP)/National Commission on Orthotic and Prosthetic Education (NCOPE) approved technician education program OR hold a high school diploma, GED or a college degree.

Those who have not completed a CAAHEP/NCOPE technician education program are required to complete two years of technical experience in the discipline under the supervision of an ABC Certified Practitioner or ABC Certified Technician in the specific discipline.
Passing score on the written exams.

23af1df2-2f90-461c-9d51-a492edd98ea6.description: An ABC Certified Prosthetic Assistant is an individual educated and trained to participate in comprehensive prosthetic care while under the supervision of an ABC Certified Prosthetist. Under supervision a Certified Prosthetic Assistant may perform prosthetic procedures and related tasks in the management of patient care as well as fabrication, repair and maintenance of prostheses. ABC Certified Prosthetic Assistants may not use their credentials as independent providers of patient care.
23af1df2-2f90-461c-9d51-a492edd98ea6.name: ABC Certified Prosthetic Assistant (CPA)

issuer.summary: issued by American Board for Certification in Orthotics, Prosthetics & Pedorthics

entity.name: American Board for Certification in Orthotics, Prosthetics & Pedorthics

badge_template_activities.title: High school diploma, GED or college degree. Successful completion of three semester hours each of the following courses; Human Anatomy, General/Fundamental Physics and Medical Terminology. Each course must be from a regionally accredited institution of higher learning.
Completion of one year (1,900) hours of clinical experience in prosthetics under the supervision of an ABC Certified Prosthetist.
Passing score on the written exam.

bd58d7ea-fa75-4bbf-a0da-cb51cac90de9.description: An ABC Certified Orthotic Technician is an individual trained and qualified to assist an ABC credentialed individual by providing technical support. ABC Certified Orthotic Technicians may not use their credentials as independent providers of patient care. The Certified Orthotic Technician fabricates, repairs and maintains orthoses and is proficient with current fabricating techniques, familiar with material properties and skilled in the use of appropriate equipment.
bd58d7ea-fa75-4bbf-a0da-cb51cac90de9.name: ABC Certified Orthotic Technician (CTO)

issuer.summary: issued by American Board for Certification in Orthotics, Prosthetics & Pedorthics

entity.name: American Board for Certification in Orthotics, Prosthetics & Pedorthics

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of a Commission on Accreditation of Allied Health Education Programs (CAAHEP)/National Commission on Orthotic and Prosthetic Education (NCOPE) approved technician education program OR hold a high school diploma, GED or a college degree.

Those who have not completed a CAAHEP/NCOPE technician education program are required to complete two years of technical experience in the discipline under the supervision of an ABC Certified Practitioner or ABC Certified Technician in the specific discipline.
Passing score on the written exam.
